page.title: 10THE GALLOWAY HYDROS
page.content: Two power stations are in this area. Glenlee uses water brought 3.5 miles by tunnel and pipeline from Clatteringshaws.With a net head of 370 feet, high speed equipment is used to output a load of 68 megawatts. Earlstoun uses the dammed Water of Ken and operates under a net head of only 69 feet.It uses special alternators which have economic advantages for low head, low speed systems.Its peak load is 12 megawatts. With its sister station Carsfad,it is normally operated remotely from Glenlee. The maximum output of the Galloway Hydros is only 105.3 megawatts but because this power can be generated within minutes, the S.S.E.B. uses it to feed into the national grid to top up supplies at times of peak demand.
